intro: Carlina vulgaris proles stricta, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
